text:
Good food. 

The server Jack is very friendly and offered us a complimentary  green tea to try. It was like a Thai tea  fusion. They are sampling it to customers for review.  We love it!

We ordered the coconut shrimp, salmon rolls, and pad see ew. The salmon rolls were unique and interesting. Delicious, too! The pad see ew was very good.

Will come back again.

Nice place.

Ordered takeout through Amazon Restaurants last night. I had the beef larb and the taste was good ... however the food gave me explosive diarrhea since 3 am. I've gone to the restroom too many times to count now. DO NOT EAT HERE unless you have some sick fetish for pain.

A pleasant surprise! place is a modern thai style bistro. We really tenjoyed the service. We ordered pineapple rice which is really good. The chicken curry was a little bland but it was still good . Thai tea was a little too sweet but tasted fresh. My personal favorite was the mango sticky rice for dessert. A must have if you eat here! The presentation of the food was A+.  Very nice and clean restaurant and restroom. Definetely will return and will try coconut ice cream.
Had the fried rice and it was really good. Even got free coconut ice cream! Coming back to try the lunch specials they look like a really good deal!

What a disappointing experience! Our medium spiced Pad Thai noodles had no flavor, even to me, someone who doesn't like spicy food. We never received our soup or yellow curry chicken (I think they were delivered to two other tables). The highlights of the evening were the jasmine tea and curry puffs. I won't be coming back here again and can't understand how they have 4.5 stars.
Amazing. It's one of those dime a dozen sushi spots but once you sit down and eat the food it becomes top notch. This place is a hidden gem. Amazing food and service.

Wow this restaurant is an amazing hidden gem.  The sauce for the egg rolls had a nice zing.  This was the best sweet n sour chicken with fresh vegetables I've had in years. For a local restaurant they had an excellent spice level n you can always ask for more spice. The restaurant is nicely decorated n inviting. The staff is friendly n attentive.

Tried for the first time; everything was very good. the place is quiet and very clean. excellent and personable customer service, including knowledgeable recommendations. the food was of high quality. the sweet & sour chicken crispy but light and not too sweet. Very very good house-made FRESH coconut ice cream. will be back for sure.

We ordered food for our office on Uber Eats at around 11am. It is currently 12:35pm, we called them to get a better estimate on our order. Their response: the health department was there and they haven't even started on it but all 8 dishes will be done in 15 minutes. Having worked in the service industry, I can attest that operations for a restaurant does not come to a screeching halt for a standard health inspection....

A pleasant surprise tucked away in a little plaza. While heading back to CA with the fam, we wanted to get off the strip and have dinner. This place hit the spot. Authentic dishes and great, clean atmosphere. Our server, Jack, was just awesome. When the Thai food cravings come around and you're in the area, definitely give this place a try!

Just ordered delivery and the food tastes good but the portion size is terribly small for what is paid. Very disappointed in that aspect. 

To the owner/answer to your question: I ordered this on the same day I left this review above.

This place was so amazing! I loved all the food here, but my favorite has to be the pineapple rice and the coconut ice cream. I know what I'll be getting next time for sure. The service here was fast and happy! I definitely recommend this place to others.

Great food, very hospitable, great service. Food is very authentic Thai. Decor and atmosphere beautifully appointed. Excellent Tom Yum Soup and Pad Thai along with pineapple fried rice. Saving the best for last the mango sticky rice was awesome!

Waited 40 min for a Togo order still not out...talk about a waste of lunch... people who came in after have received their food. Amazing... do not come for lunch expecting to get back to work in time

Great food tho

Ordered on line on a Thursday night.  Food was ready when I got there and the place was empty.  But the food was tasty.  I don't recall an option online to select spice/heat level but I wish it had been a little spicier.  I like heat though so it might be perfect for others as is.  One minor complaint was the chicken meat quality.  Had a few too many bits of cartilage in it.  Not enough to ruin it but enough to notice and question.  I will likely try it again.

They don't know how to make Tom yum soup. They don't put tomatoes in it and instead they put onions. I've had Tom yum so many times so many different places and onions don't go in it. It just didn't taste right.
The food was delicious and beautifully presented. The pot stickers were to die for! Jack, our waiter was very polite, pleasant and helpful. We will be back and would recommend to all.

An amazing place to go for lunch! I especially like it because it's nearby school and the lunch prices are amazing. They even give a stamp card so you can get a free lunch when you eat there 10 times so I will be coming back here quite often :)

We were looking for another restaurant and decided to give this one a try. It turned out to be a wonderful meal. The food was tasty and made with seemingly fresh ingredients and the price was very reasonable. The service was great as well.

Place is Clean and Beautifully Kept.  The food is servered with good presentation and most important THE FOOD TASTES GREAT.

Must try CRAB FRIED RICE & Tom Yum Soup ... both of them which i tried was flavouful and yummy.

Will be heading here more often.

Great service. The staff and management is so friendly. A must try. Food is very attractive and tasty. Will
Be back to try other dishes !
Service was great and the food was really good .. I got the mint chicken with black rice lunch special and my friend got the steak. Both were very flavorful and the steak was cooked perfect ..
Literally the best Thai food I've ever had. If I wasn't in such a food coma I would provide more detail. Try everything!!!
Great food. Thai and Chinese fusion. Amazing service and friendly owner/chef. I highly recommend this place.
A very nice restaurant. The food was fresh and servicexwas great and the Thai tea was amazing. I'm glad I live close by!

Thai food is one of my favorites. I have been to many from archies to lotus of Siam and I was not expecting this place to be the best Thai food I have ever had. The ribeye panang and crab fried rice are phenomenal! Most places the panang curry does not taste like it was made from scratch, here it taste soooooooo fresh. The crab fried rice, also blew me away because it not only came with lots of crab meat but they also put soft shell crab in it. It is unreal how great this place is and how empty it is. I really hope it does well and people start filling up the tables because I would love to be able to come here for years to come!!
I live in summerlin and travel to henderson just for their food. If that's not enough, service is beyond excellent! Thank you Buddha Thai Bistro, you have become my favorite Thai restaurant!!!!!

Pad See Ew is my favorite Thai dish and it was delicious. It was made with beef and they did not skimp on the meat. Not only was it delicious but was plated with a beautiful flower on the side. The waiter was attentive without being obtrusive. We also had the beef soup and were delighted with the cinnamon undertone. We opted for the new curry puff appetizer and they were flavorful and crispy. Great place!
Awesome environment and food! Served gluten free on request so the wife could eat and has No reaction  Will come again!
This place was amazing. This is where I took my first bite of pineapple fried rice, now it's my favorite rice! If you were craving some Thai food, this is the right place to go!

So pleased with this place!! Fell in love with the red curry with veggie and the green Thai tea! My girlfriend had the chicken chow mein and it was also really good. Mmmm!!
I'll be back next week haha

Stopped for lunch. Chicken pot stickers were great not greasy. I had sweet and sour chicken lunch special. Salad,soup,egg roll (also not greasy). Food was hot and fresh. Great flavor. Wife Chili mint chicken and she also thought it was excellent. A definite come back.

This place was a hidden gem. Super nice on the inside. You can tell they take pride into keeping the business super clean. Staff was attentive and nice. 
I had the fresh spring rolls. Yummy! Not in the menu, but ask for them. Chicken satay was cooked perfect. I like that it came within  peanut and  cucumber dipping sauces. 
Loved the taste of the green curry. Pad Thai with delicious large shrimp and was tasty. 
Will definitely be coming back-
Just tried this place out and it's the best Thai food I've had since moving to Vegas. We had 4 different items and each one was better than the last. I can't wait to come back.

This place is a hidden gem! We didn't order a ton of food but everything we had was great! And our server was very welcoming, sweet and on top of everything! 2 for 1 sake during happy hour, you can't beat that! We will be coming back to try more stuff!

Took a chance to try this place late at night right before closing and the food was excellent and had some outstanding spices unique style of preparation and everything came up piping hot and delicious great happy hour check them out
Enjoyed the Pad Thai, Sautéed Veggies and Chicken Laab (Larb)! We'll be back to try the Yellow Curry dishes!

This place was amazing! The service was excellent! The food was fresh, well seasoned, adequately portioned and fairly priced. In short, it was phenomenal. Cute intimate little date place for me and my boo. Quiet and peaceful atmosphere. Some of if not the best thai/Chinese food in the Valley!

So this is actually one of my favorite restaurants close to the house. However I am very unimpressed with how long the food took to get out of the kitchen, so far I ordered to go and I have waited over an hour for my food to be prepared ". However everyone in the restaurant has gotten their food first before us. The whole restaurant has gotten their food and we are still waiting on a to go order. To be honest for how long we waited we could have picked up our family and brought them to the restaurant and still have been home before the food was done. This is absolutely unacceptable.

We had such a great dinner! We started with chicken wings and they were delicious, but very hot. Our servers name was Night. We then had won Ton soup and it was also delicious. We then ordered Panang Curry and the Drunken Noodles and to finish the night with the sticky rice with mangos. I will suggest everyone go eat here the food is delicious and fabulous the service by Knight was out of this world and she was so sweet.

Walked in to see the menu, 2 employees sitting on their laptop while another doing something at the bar, after 3 mins of not being greeted not even a hello, I walked out. There are way too many Thai/Asian food places in this town, I wish them the best cause it was 5 o'clock and the place was empty

I had the chow mien when I went the first time and the lunch special pad Thai on the second. Pad Thai was much better. The place is super clean with a positive vibe to it and the owner is a culinary graduate from le cordon blue. I loved the portions and their side sauce are the best.

I had the chicken and veggies. Didn't feel cheated or like in was being I loaded on sugar and salt and the veggies were not over cooked. The crab Rangoon had actual detectable crab meat (not cream cheese crab purée) and shrimp roll was yummy too.

I have literally been to every Thai restaurant in Las Vegas and Henderson in search of the best curry. Buddha Thai Bistro wins, hands down. I will be recommending others. Thank you for being so friendly and inviting, it was welcomed and appreciated.
Really good Thai Food! The place has a very well put together ambiance and decor. I had the Thai Crab fried rice, Beef Pad Thai and shrimp roll. Everything was tasty and presented nicely.
What a pleasant surprise.  Food and service is top notch.  Great Thai food in the middle of Henderson.  Will definitely be back again.
Great place for a relaxing dinner! Jack the server is very accommodating! LOVE the Thai green tea

Have no complaints about the taste of the food, but was told 20 minutes for takeout and it took 35. On top of that, the portions were quite small for dinner prices. Seemed like they were lunch special size portions, definitely not enough food for dinner prices. I get full easily and almost never eat more than 1/2 my food. My husband didn't even get my leftovers because I ate every bite of the entree I got.

We've ordered from Buddha Bistro several times via Postmates and each time, the food's been great! 

The crab rangoon is awesome, really cheesy - so if you like a little less crab taste and a little more cream cheese, this one would be right up your alley. The chicken satay is well-marinated and tender, you almost don't need the peanut sauce (but who would pass it up?)

The chicken pad se ew is definitely the best I've had on this side of town, and the tom kha is delicious. It's a really large serving, enough for two meals. Plus, they have a mild/medium/spicy scale, but include the spices separately so you can mix in to your taste, which is a nice touch. Much better than guessing you'd be fine with medium, ordering it mixed in and losing.

The food has always arrived fresh and packaged to stay that way, but I'm definitely going to check this place out to dine in sometime in the future.

1st of all, I came in before 3pm & the place was empty...I was in the mood for some Thai food & wanted to give them a try...should have listened to the reviews...I ordered a yellow curry & potatoes had a weird taste & chicken was rubbery. The waiter took it back & said the chef will cook another one. So it seemed like 5 min & portion got smaller, & same problem.  I walked out & if I can give 0 stars for food quality I would.  I should've went to Thai house.

They were great, from the service to the presentation and especially the taste and quality. The Pad Thai, pad-se-iew and the chicken fried rice were amazing. We will go back as its the best Thai we've had in Henderson!

I loved eating here! I ordered off their lunch specials one day while I was at work. The food was delicious and it didn't take very long to prepare! The customer service was very friendly and the place itself was very clean. The second I took my first bite, I told my coworker (who I was having lunch with) I HAD TO Yelp this!

We have been here 3 times already and will keep coming back. This is the most flavorful pad se ew I've ever tasted. Nothing disappointed us on their menu so far. We also got to try the chefs made from scratch coconut and Thai iced tea ice creams... SO... GOOD! If you're looking for great Thai food, eat here.

I absolutely love this place! Such a great local, whole in the wall place that has amazing food and super affordable! 

It was completely empty when I ate here, but there were multiple people coming in for take out orders through Uber eats, etc. The waitress was super nice and attentive to us and made sure that everything was going well! Later on in the even, then multiple other groups started showing up for dine in. 

The food was very affordable but absolutely delicious! The portion sizes as well I thought were perfect and just rice! I am a huge fried rice gal, and this surpassed my expectations by far! This will be my go to thai and Chinese food restaurant from now on'!

The food was really good, but it took us a really long time to get it! I still gave 4 stars because it seemed like they were short handed on this particular night and they also threw in some free ice cream for the trouble :).

We ordered drunken noodles and panang curry. The flavors of the food was really good but the portion sizes were very small. The noodles were on a bed of Lettuce to make the container appear full but there wasn't a lot of the actual entree. The panang curry was full of zucchini and not a lot of other veggies or meat. Even though the food tasted good I would not order from here again due to the small portion sizes.
We have tried a lot of neighboring Thai places and this one is the best, by far! We had the beef fried rice, beef drunken noodles, and crab Rangoon. So delicious, very flavorful and fairly priced!

Awesome food with equally great presentation.  My only gripe was their sign outside says free thai tea but didn't offer it.  When I mentioned they refused to provide it.  Otherwise this place would have been 5 stars.

One of the best Thai place. I will be one of those loyal customer. Service is good food is bomb. Excellent over all. I do recommend to everyone to try it's worth it and have you decide what you think.

We decided to try this place out after reading some good reviews. The food was just alright; not bad, but not great either. The spice level in the yellow curry was spot on, I must say! We had it delivered, and did ask for a couple of simple requests. No raisins in one dish, and steamed tofu instead of fried.
 Neither request was fulfilled, which was disappointing. All things considered, we probably won't be ordering from here again.

Friend and I ordered through GrubHub. Estimated delivery 1+ hour. Arrived in 25 minutes -- sweet! Everything was delicious - yellow curry entree with rice and appetizers: absolutely wonderful potstickers, drizzled with a totally lovely sauce, salmon rolls (basically egg rolls with a big piece of salmon in it), and crab rangoon.  It gets a 4 instead of 5 *s rating for the following reasons: (1) the menu indicated the salmon rolls had cheese in them--if there was, it was completely indiscernible, and (2) the food was piping hot--except for the crab rangoon, which was delicious but not simply room temperature, but actually cold (not sure how that is even possible). Looking forward to trying again--maybe in the restaurant next time. I wish them well--2nd best Thai food I've had in the area.
First time here, used Uber Eats to deliver. Tom Kai soup was delicious, chicken moist and flavorful, coconut shrimp crispy and garlic beef spicy...Will definitely order from here again !
The restaurant is nice and very clean. The food was decent but not the best Thai food I've had. But the service was great so I'm giving this place 5 stars.
Everyone was very friendly and food was delicious!! Portions are a good size.. will definitely be back.. shared the beef satay for appetizer and curry chicken and garlic chicken for entrees.

Yay! I found a place that does awesome Egg Drop Soup. Just plain, simple Egg Drop Soup with nothing random added (like corn or peas) Their recipe is perfect! 

I also ordered the Kung Pao chicken at a medium spicy and it was very good. Quality chicken and there was a good amount of veggies. Typically, I do like my meals with a little more sauce.... But after I added all the rice it ended up being just fine. 

I think I have a new takeout place (or delivery) I love that they have Thai and Chinese choices. I can't wait to try more stuff!

Delicious food and a cool restaurant located off of hectic Eastern Ave.
Decore inside is traditional and modern. This sanctuary located off the busiest road in Henderson is a welcome addition to the tons of restaurants in the area. Service is spot on and prompt. Good Thai tea and the Singha beer is nice and cold.
Coconut crab appetizer is tasty and the plum sauce is a sweet addition. I kind of suspect the shrimp might be from a package, but still decent.
Yellow curry was too spicy for me at medium level, but still very very good. Carrots were cut in such an labor intensive way and the potato in this dish is cooked perfectly. Drunken Noodles are very good, but will have to say the noodles to everything else ratio is a bit off with less noodles than normal, but still well cooked, flavorful and not greasy. Every piece of meat in the dish was tender and seasoned perfectly.
Chicken fried rice is excellent and the chicken is tender and lots of it. Tastes great, but the presentation is a bit off since the dish is monochromatic.
Portions to me was just right and still some food left over to go.
Resonable prices and great service, I need to come back and try the lunch specials and other numerous dishes.
Awesome place, but if headed south on Eastern it's a bit of a challenge to make that left turn into the parking lot since there is so much traffic.
The left overs are already calling my name. 
A very good restaurant, I like it.

This restaurant is a hidden gem, absolutely worth out for the price and service! They just opened recently, so they're still building their customer base and getting their name out. I went in for the lunch special and ordered the Pad Thai, and not only was it made to my specifications, but it was quick, and the waiter was so nice and accommodating. I really hope more people discover this place, because it really is a great little restaurant.

The lunch specials start at $6.99 and comes with soup,  salad, rice, and egg roll with sweet chili sauce. They have a wide variety of Thai dishes. Don't judge a restaurant by the amount of people inside! Small family restaurants that start out always need time to reach their stride. If this place was closer to my part of town, I would eat lunch here everyday.
Small portion no flavor dinner doesn't even include soup or salad dissatisfaction is a understatement

You know somethings is really good when you can't wait to get home and YELP about it.  Buddha Thai Bistro is a pleasant surprise. Maybe that's why I liked it so much.

Today, my intention was to visit the Hawaiian-style restaurant a few doors down. Due to my early work hours, I go to lunch before 12, making me so happy to beat the lunch rush. And because of this, the parking lot for Buddha Thai Bistro was empty. What caught my eye at Buddha Thai was their handwritten signage near their door indicating that lunch specials start at $6.99. Good enough for me to re-direct my attention.

This restaurant took over a Peruvian restaurant that was here for years. I've always wanted to go to that restaurant but never was able to as my husband insisted that we go to the Hawaiian restaurant because he just had to have poke. When I saw the Peruvian restaurant had closed and that a Thai restaurant took over, I actually resented them for it and refused to even look their way. I was so disturbed by the opening of another Thai and/or Chinese restaurant, that I actually snickered each time I drove past it in the parking lot. I'm sorry :(

In any case, I thought to myself, I couldn't pass up lunch at under $10. I'll try it this one time. I walked in and was pleasantly surprised to see their modern decor. It is smaller than the Thai restaurant in the next door parking lot, but this place seems nicer.

I was greeted by the nice gentleman and quickly reviewed the lunch specials in order to beat others coming in and getting their orders in before mine. I was in the mood for fried noodles and ordered the Chow Mein with chicken, instead of getting the Pad Thai or the Yellow curry.

Other items on the lunch menu include Chili and Mint, Stir-fried mix veggies, Sweet and sour, Mongolian, and Stir-fried American broccoli.  Choices for these dishes are Mixed veggies and tofu where the price is right at $6.99. Adding chicken raises the price to $7.99, adding beef raises to $8.99 or adding shrimp will cost you $9.99.

What I love about Thai restaurants and their lunch specials is that it comes with more, like soup, salad and an egg roll.  What I learned later is that it comes with THAI TEA or thai coffee.  Thai Tea me please! 

First came the vegetable soup, which was ok.

While seated at the table, they do have other specials listed on the different cards. Unfortunately, during lunch, no curry pastries are available :(  So I settled on shrimp shumai. It comes with six pieces, it is beautifully arranged, and tasted alright. When they mean shrimp shumai, they really mean shrimp and not shrimp on top of the pork.  This cost me $7.99.

Then came my main dish served on a really large platter. My lunch special included a serving of chow mein, green salad, egg roll and sweet sour sauce for the egg roll.  The egg roll was okay. The salad dressing, however, was delicious. I wish I knew what it was but I didn't ask because I could barely understand my waiter. And I thought my chow mein was really good. Both the chicken and chow mein had a slight bbq grill taste to it.

The other thing that is going to bring me back probably tomorrow for happy hour, $3.99 appetizers and buy one drink, get the second free.And you know what? The curry pastries is on that list!

One additional great thing about Buddha Thai Bistro, they participate in Yelps cash back program. Cash back is 7%.  As soon as they rang me up, I immediately got a message from Yelp that my cash back would be $1.21. It really is nice to be repaid for eating out.

So great atmosphere, great customer service, good food, great price. I'll give this place 5-stars.

Ordered their food using the Postmates app. Not very pleased with the quality or taste. I ordered the yellow curry medium and chow mein mild. The chow mein was not mild and so spicy that I could not even eat it. Would not order from them again and 80% of the food ended up in the trash after finding white (possibly cat) hair. No thank you!
Best food and best service. Always refilling our waters and make sure to be very attentive to your table. Food is SO delicious.

I was pretty upset my previous review.  I feel like one to go order shouldnt ruin them for me.  I think this restaurant is pretty great.  They work hard the food comes out great (for the most part) and everyone has some bad days.  Honestly sometimes mistakes happen.  I was a bit too hot headed the previous time, and I think people should always give restaurants chances to make up for it.  Its pretty awesome that the owner would come and talk about the issue with the customer.  solid joint, with my favorite boat noodle soup.
Very good hidden spot.. very fresh looking food and everything we ordered tasted good. We will definitely be coming back soon now hat we live in the area
I've only ordered take out but their food is really good and at good prices. The best pad see ew I've ever had. I would definitely recommend.

I came here for lunch and ordered Chicken Pad Thai and must say it's very delicious. It's very fresh and it was a large portion for me for lunch. Price is pretty reasonable.

A definitely a must try if u want good authentic Thai Food.
Excellent service and great food! We will come back again. Now I know where to order good phad thai nearby.

This restaurant was awesome, I enjoyed the shrimp shuma appetizer! Also the desert was delicious. The coconut ice cream is a must taste!
Finally, you get an awesome waiter! His name is Jack!

I placed an order via yelp with delivery to my home  via Grubhub. Big mistake! According to the yelp app I was supposed to receive a confirmation email...which I did not. I waited 15 min to call after I received no email. When I called a man who barely spoke English answered. He confirmed my order & phone number. I had to ask when it would be delivered- he stammered around & finally came up with 30 minutes. 
An hour later still no food. I called again & got the same man who barely spoke English. He stated the order was for pickup. He then handed the phone over to a man who could speak English (why didn't this happen in the first place?) He stated the order was for pick up & that I should call Grubhub to see what time they could pick up & deliver. I then told him to cancel the order & I would be contacting my credit card company. 

I then had to call Grubhub (another man that could barely speak English). I again explained things. He asked for my phone number -
Couldn't find record of it. He then asked my email. After repeating 3 times because he didn't understand English I gave up. Again, told him I would be contacting my credit card company. 

I would think twice about ordering from this restaurant or Grubhub....
This was a nice Thai Restaurant we discovered driving by on Eastern in Henderson. Food was excellent and really enjoyed it. We'll be back.

Got some delivery from Uber Eats this evening and was definitely impressed! Very tasty Thai food. I ordered the won ton noodle soup and the black pepper & garlic tofu entree. 

The soup broth was not too oily and had a clean flavor. They separated the noodles and wontons to keep them fresh for the delivery which was nice. 

I've never tried a pepper/garlic dish before but it was amazing. I only ordered tofu because adding meat made it a little too pricey and the portion size was nice for 1 but would like a bit more for the price. The Thai sauce they provided on the side was so good too. Definitely a game changer.

Try this place out for a night in at least once. I'm sure you'll want to come back for more.

My family and I stopped by for an early dinner. We devoured the Beef Satay, Seafood Panang Curry, and Pad Si Ew. Portion size was fair, pricing was good, and the waiter check in with us often to make sure we were ok. I recommend for a relaxing meal after work or school.

I missed the lunch special, it is Mon to Fri (came in on Saturday).  I ordered the pad thai with chicken (classic).  It was highly recommended by the waitress.  The spicy level was medium, dish was colorful and food tasted great. Medium was too spicy for my American pallet (but perfect for my Asian pallet), so I would order a little less than medium next time for my friends.
This is the best Thai food I ever had in Las Vegas. We had Soft shell crab salad, it was excellent. Papaya salad was delicious & very fresh. Pad Thai was perfect. Green tea drink put out the fire.

I used uber eats which was quick and easy. I eat a lot of Thai food and I must say this is some of the best I've had in Vegas, definitely gained a new customer. I had the Pad Thai and the Panang Curry

The food had good flavor so they know what they're doing, but that being said for the price per entree the portion size is entirely too small. We ordered delivery, over $70 worth with a good variety of entrees & apps because it was our first time and we wanted to have enough to decide if we'd use them again. Like I said the flavor was great, but it came in small bowls (similar to the rice bowls you'd get @ Panda Ex). The items I paid an extra dollar to add chicken to literally had 3-5 bites of chicken added to them. 
Unless they improve portion/price ratio I would not recommend this restaurant.

Delicious food, nice atmosphere good ambiance and friendly staff. We came in 30 min before closing and was greeted nicely. Food was served within minutes of order. Portions are just right and prices were reasonable.

So disappointed. Another day, another miss while getting take out by trying a new place. After a wild weekend at EDC me & my friend who's visiting from out of town decided we were craving some Thai food & I've been wanting to try this place for a while now. Ugh. Big mistake. We ordered yellow curry with chicken & shrimp pad thai. 

Both dishes were flavorless, bland and quite frankly beyond bad. We could not finish our meal had & ended up throwing everything away! What a waste of money! The yellow curry chicken had a weird flavor that was very bland and severely generic. 

The chicken had a rough chewy texture & tasted gross. It had no flavor at all. The shrimp pad thai was really soggy & the shrimp was rubbery and obviously frozen & low quality. Both dishes had absolutely no flavor. 

I really wanted to love this place and recommend it but unfortunately my meal was very disappointing on all levels. Such a bummer!

I just ate.  What a wonderful little place.  Service was on point. The food was really good.  HTomYum Soup, Pot Stickers, Pad Si Eiw and I enjoyed it all.  Portions are really good size.  I will be back.

I don't just get Thai food cravings, I get Buddha Thai Bistro cravings.  I haven't exactly tasted the whole menu, but from the two things I consistently get, I have never been disappointed. Their seafood salad and seafood soup is toooooo die for. You get the great amount of seafood in both entrees, and it always has the perfect amount of  "sour/lemony" taste to it. Out of all the different types of Asian foods, I think Thai best fits my appetite, and this place just excites every little taste bud! I love this place and I will continue to go back!
Came in late, but were still seated graciously. Beautiful presentation and delicious food. Try the homemade coconut ice cream.

First and last time ordering food from here. I placed a to-go order of pad sew eww (mild) and chicken basil (medium spice level). Within 35 minutes of consuming, I had a severe stomach ache. I eat Thai often and have ordered from many restaurants throughout Henderson/Las Vegas. 

Restaurant was completely dead the afternoon I ordered takeout. I (should) have taken as a sign, not to order food when its during lunch and zero patrons. Beware.

I enjoy trying new places, great spice levels. The woman who took my order spoke limited English, she got my order exactly right and upsold me a SUPER tasty sticky rice and mango desert.  Probably won't be eating inside the restaurant, needs a makeover. The to go order was filled with a spicy Thai powder, and thee other sauces, I'm loving it.  Always wanting to support locals trying to make a buck, I'll be back. My wife likes curry so she can get some yellow.  

With that said " Good Job Buddha"
Enjoy your Summer all
Great happy hour menu & lunch menu! Great curry and noodles. Service was incredible and the owner is super helpful and gave us a free green Thai tea to sample!! Recommend 100%.
I recommend you should order the fried fish with Thai chili sauce. The fish is very big and so delicious. Tom yum is so so but not bad. I love Thai green tea here, too. I will come back!!!

We came in here for a really quick bite and we're not disappointed. Super friendly and quick. The red curry with tofu was perfect. The drunken noodles with tofu were great as well. Not soggy like some places serve and the tofu was crispy. The owners are from northern Thailand but the menu has lots of non Thai choices too. We will be back.
very affordable and great taste. lunch spetial includes pad Thai and rice and free thai tea, salads, egg roll!

Very good! I had the Wor won ton noodle soup, it was mildy spicy, very tasty. The service was great our server was very attentive and very nice. My husband had the Wor won soup he enjoyed his as well. We will be back!

First time here, it was completely empty and it has a strange old hotel, cigarette type of smell. But decided to stay. Service was good no complaints there. They have a variety of liquor bottles on display so we assumed they have liquor but they only serve wine and beer. Happy hour has bogo beer and bogo hot\cold sake. I ordered both the seafood Panang $13.99 and the papaya salad $8.99 in the highest spice level. The papaya salad was super hot and made my eyes water the panang was just right, nice and spicy. It would be nice to have a little more sour and fish sauce in the salad but it was still good.
Came in here with a good appetite and the portions were so generous I couldn't finish my dish. That never happens. Great service and very attentive. Will be coming here often.

Amazing little gem for a Thai Restaurant ,  you would never imagine it looks the way it does inside from looking outside , very trendy, semi formal & Proffessional . I was my first time there & went strictly from the yelp reviews & it was right on ! Super delicious ,inexpensive for lunch & the waiter made me feel super welcome ! Outstanding service

Great food! The Thai tea is delicious and I love how there is a $4 appetizer happy hour and BOGO wine, beer, and sake. The coconut shrimp was so good and the potstickers were decorated in a tasty sauce. The presentation of the plating makes you feel like you're in a fancy restaurant, but the prices are very reasonable. In a bit of a shady area, but I felt very safe inside the restaurant. Will be coming again. Very satisfied.

I think it's great that the Thai tea is included in the lunch specials... The pad Thai lunch special was delicious. I ordered with chicken and opted for medium heat and BOY does that have a kick!!! My husband ordered the mangolian beef lunch special and he said it was "ok". So I'm sure we'll be back to try another option on the lunch special menu.

My husband and I recently ordered from here through UberEats and really enjoyed the food. Our food arrived well packaged and the restaurant prepared the food in a timely manner.

We ordered Chicken Pad Thai and Beef Drunken Noodles. Each dish was offered with any protein of your choice, but chicken and beef were our choices for our dishes. Both dishes were delicious. The sauces were great and the overall dishes were well flavored. The meats were good in both dishes.

Pricing was reasonable for the portion sizes. The portions were maybe a bit smaller than other Thai restaurants, but the pricing was less so it balanced out. 

I'd definitely order from here or stop in to enjoy a meal in the future.
We came here on Christmas and the placed was packed.  The food was beautifully presented and tasted delicious.  My Thai husband said the food was authentic.  We will be back!
This place has amazing food and an even more amazing prices. The service was exemplary and the atmosphere was comforting.

I am the most picky person when it comes to food, especially authentic thai food. If you love thai food as much as I do, you don't want to miss this place. I ordered all of my favorite dishes and each one of them was incredible. This is by far the best Thai restaurant in the area and believe me, I tried them all! Great service, great environment, on top of amazing traditional thai food. You don't want to miss this place, I hope to introduce to as many people as I can because they're so deserving of it, and it's hard to find this kind of good food these days. My highlights include Tom Yum soup, the Beef larb salad, but all other dishes will be as amazing. Go there once, and see how you become a regular!

I came here for their incredibly priced $6.99 lunch special and I was not disappointed. Along with your main course (for me it was the chicken Pad Thai), it also came with a salad, a tasty eggroll, and a surprisingly delicious side of fried rice. On top of that, you get a glass of refreshing Thai tea. It's so much good food at a satisfying price.

I fell in love with Thai food in Southern California, where I was able to consistently find amazing Drunken Noodles. I've search 4 other states in search of comparable Thai food and have had no luck whatsoever. Until today! Buddha Thai has the absolute best Thai food I've had outside of Southern California. The drunken noodles were perfection and the fried rice was to die for! Great flavor, perfect veggies, medium spicy was perfect. I can finish searching, I have found my go-to Thai place anytime I'm in this area. Just amazing!

I enjoyed the Pad Thai shrimp lunch special $9.99 and it did not disappoint.  The flavor was good, I ordered spicy but it wasn't so hot that I couldn't enjoy the taste.  I had the fried wonton as appetizer but it has no meat but still wanted to try it. It was crispy with a nice flavor and the sweet and sour dipping sauce pairs well with it. Actually their sweet and sour sauce is the best I've ever had thus far.  Next time trying sweet and sour something.  The ambiance is relaxing, no one else was in here so it was very quite and serene.  Customer service was great!  And when I checked in there was a 20% off coupon.
Great food. Nice presentation. The place is clean. Enjoyed our lunch. Will try their dinner.

The food here is outstanding. My son and I stopped here one day on our way to another food place in he same plaza and we're blown away with the quality of the food. 

They had the best calamari that I've ever tasted. My son and I order calamari as an appetizer almost everywhere we go and we both kept commenting on how flavorful, tender and well seasoned they were without being greasy. 

I ordered the green curry and it was sooo good. He ordered a soup and he kept commenting on how he was going to bring his friends there to eat since the food was so good. 

They blow Other Thai restaurants on Eastern out of the water. I hope they succeed since that plaza is kind of ick.
The food is good. The service was great! Aka took really good care of us. We will be back for the great service. Thank you

I'm going to start by saying the food was delicious! 5 for the food!!! Great flavor, spice level was just right, great portions and priced correctly. Eat everything! 

I was here on Friday night. There was a large group in the center when we walked in .... To complete quiet. No music and everyone just stared at us, probably because we were talking as we walked in (because who expects deafening silence upon entering a restaurant?). We got over it pretty quick and sat down. I noticed there was only one person working the floor and he seemed very flustered. He was attentive enough but in an inconvenient way... Taking things off the table too quickly, not asking the right questions, etc. 
I'm an ex-restaurant manager from NYC and I've seen everything so I wasn't annoyed or angry... my boyfriend can't say the same. 
I really wanted to get up and help the server better prioritize his approach to handling tables and take out orders as the only server working. I believe the manager was there and was helping to run the food and, I would guess, packing up orders and expediting.

Overall I definitely want to come back, the drunken noodle was fantastic! And I'm hoping it was a simple under-staffed situation with the service. But please, please turn the music to a proper level. I don't like talking at a whisper so the table next to me won't be in my conversation.

Well it is kind of expensive. And they are trying to be really fancy in a parking lot that doesn't feel fancy. But the food is great.  If you don't like the price fine but, and this is a big BUT.  Their coconut ice cream is the best thing I've ever had!! They make it in house!! If you don't eat dinner here at least come here for dessert it's worth it.

Buddha Bistro does a great job of providing both tasty food with quick, friendly service. I ordered the pineapple fried rice, which was delicious although the chicken was a bit dry. The portion was generous enough to share between 2 people. The restaurant has a calming atmosphere with authentic decor. Will definitely be stopping back sometime to try out their lunch specials!
First time here and it was excellent food and friendly service and clean and nice atmosphere.  Come try it!

Soon as you walk in it was dead silent. No music or ambience. But I was here for the food. The flavor, freshness, and portion was all very good. Service was very good too. The value and wonderful prices is what makes me want to come back for their lunch specials. Eating in dead silence and whispering at a restaurant, for that reason I can't give 4 stars. But come for the food, it won't disappoint.

Ordered the lunch special with medium spice yellow curry to-go. The yellow curry didn't have enough flavor or spices and was hella watery. The chicken in the curry was rubbery with no flavor at all and the medium is not at all medium; more like mild. There was also this weird rancid taste to the curry? 
Not a solid yellow curry and considering my experience I don't see why it's one of their most popular items. You would think that because it was a popular item, there would be a little more TLC put into it. 
The lunch special does come with a good amount of food for $6.99 + tax. It came with a soup, side of rice, salad, entree, and egg roll. But if you get an order to-go maybe don't put the egg roll with the dressing soaked salad next time, Buddha Bistro.

On the up side: the egg drop soup was good.

Such a cute little place with a very nice atmosphere, service was very very good and the workers were extremely polite. The food was amazing, ( especially the crab Rangoon's ) and on top of it the pricing isn't expensive ! Will definitely return.
A great hidden Place. Great Decor great service excellent food. Portions are larger than you would expect and everything was fresh.
This place is bomb! Great food, customer service and over all atmosphere! Come inn and enjoy yourself!!

Have eaten here a couple times over the last couple weeks...so have only tried a few things. The pai thai is AMAZING!!! The best I've ever had. The spicy beef salad is so fresh. The eggs rolls are awesome. They have this chili sauce that is different from any other place and I could seriously put it on pizza. One of the other reviews mentioned not enough meat...I have NEVER had that problem. And I'm glad the food is fresh instead of obviously boiling all night with no nutrients...so i would be ok with little harder veggies....they probably work for pin kaow.
Delicious food, excellent service, extremely clean and average prices...most dishes under $10. We'll definitely be back!!!

The dinner portions were small for the price, and they gave us microwave chicken nuggets in the sweet and sour chicken. 

The drunken noodles were OK, nothing special, but there was very little.  They asked how spicy and I said not at all, but it still came out spicy.

They aren't officially open yet, so maybe they will improve.

Mediocre. 

We used postmates to order 2x Soups, 1x entree, 1x dessert, and a drink....$74! Ridiculous. I will not order from here again nor use Postmates. Too expensive. I should have went with instinct one and got it myself. Laziness prevailed and I trusted Postmates once again. I will mention the delivery personnel were friendly and prompt. I prefer them over Uber eats.

Before we discovered this outrageous total. We tried the food....
I forgive certain aspects of the food when ordering delivery. I will not complain if it's lukewarm or not crispy as expected. 
The Tom Kha was very average and the coconut milk looked like curdled milk. Not aesthetically pleasing at all.The Tom Yum was ok, not spectacular. 
The Red Curry was actually quite good. I especially enjoyed this dish. It paired very well with the rice. 
The Fried Banana had a piece of onion in the roll which turned us OFF immediately. I do not like onions. The vegetable rolls were bland, but probably were awesome when they were fresh. The sauce was way too sweet. 

After bookmaking this business and waiting to try their cuisine....I am thoroughly disappointed. I however, will try it again fresh. Picking it up myself!

The Pad Thai Lunch special was not bad, it's just a scoop of pad thai and a scoop of steam rice. Really? $6.99 may seem like a great price but be mindful that Thailicious off Stephanie is also $6.99 and give almost a full size Pad Thai.  And not to mention only one server running the whole show. Not like he's bad or slow, it's just sometimes customer don't want to rely on only one server.  Needless to say, we won't be back. I just don't understand why other people say they get big portion during lunch time, am I just being discriminated against.

I discovered this restaurant on Postmates a couple weeks ago.  My favorite Thai restaurant closed, so I was in search of another one that had good Pad Thai.  I got their tofu pad thai (medium spicy), and I must say, it was delicious.  In fact, I like it better than the previous go-to Thai restaurant.  Last week, my hubby and I decided to check out there restaurant and eat there.  It was Easter Sunday, so we were the only ones in there.  The inside of the restaurant is cute and hip, and they also serve wine and alcohol!  Their service was quick, and the pad thai was just as good as the first time.  We will be coming back!

Great food, great service (one guy serving the whole restaurant... might need more help if it's busier!), the music just needs to be a little louder. It made it awkward to have a convo in here. But it was good!! And if you like SUPER spicy, ask for Thai Spicy. It's no joke!!

Buddha Thai Bistro is one of the many restaurants that I have drove by, wanted to try, but never did. My go-to Thai restaurant is across town, but we were craving Panang curry and opted to give it a try. It was a pleasant surprise and we really enjoyed our lunch. 

My boyfriend ordered the Panang curry with tofu and I ordered the Basil & Chili with chicken from the lunch special. The lunch special comes with egg drop soup, a vegetarian eggroll, a salad, and the entree. The best part is that it also comes with the option of Thai coffee or Thai iced tea for the low price of $7.99 (for chicken. It's less or more for other choices of meat). Both entrees came with rice as well. We ordered the chicken at a level three in spice and the Panang curry at "medium" in spice. Heads up - medium is HOT. The panang curry was delicious regardless and had a really good flavor. In my opinion, the basil and chili chicken was too salty. They were very generous with the vegetables though and the rice offset it. 

The server was really attentive and friendly despite the fact that a lunch time Saturday crowd came in at once and she was the only waitress on the floor. She was giving everyone attention whether it was people dining in or those ordering take-out. 

I would come here again if I was craving Thai and didn't want to travel too far. In addition, their lunch special is on point!

I hail from beautiful California, where food from different cultures is everywhere. Thai food is one of my favorite things to eat. I have yet to find a great Thai food in Henderson/Vegas until now. Buddha Bistro has exceeded my expectations. From the outstanding service, fresh food, and wonderful atmosphere I recommend anyone and everyone to try it. I'll definitely be coming back!!

Oh yeah this place hit the spot!! 
Very friendly welcoming when entering.  Clean and overall beautifully decorated. 

The menu was on the larger side but after a few dishes we are very excited to try it all!

We started with the wonton soup. Its a staple dish for us. .. so we are constantly looking for the best. This place does it right the flavor of the broth is spiced perfectly. The wontons do not get lost they can stand alone,  with ground pork and whole baby shrimp... yummy! 

Then we enjoyed the soft shell crab fried rice. Whoa! The rice alone is amazing but top it off with a healthy portion of crab. It was so tender and mixed to perfection. If you are an egg freak like I get a lil wild order a fried egg and add it to your rice.  Mouth watering!

If we weren't full enough we ordered chinese broccoli with beef. It was worth the button popping of our pants. Crisp broccoli with thinly sliced beef. The sauce, yes, not too salty or sweet it was just right! Also i will mention they do not use fillers in there sauce,  which for me is a huge plus.  

We were absolutely full. .. but if you have room for a few more bites.  YOU MUST TRY HOMEMADE COCONUT ICE CREAM! It's creamy yet icy with tender pieces of natural coconut. I ate the whole scoop and regret nothing! Lol

A must try in our opinion. We will be back!!

Darn. I ordered from here once and it was great. Ordered again and this time it was disappointing. I specifically asked for my shrimp to not be overcooked and it was basically rubber. They only filled my Pad Thai container under 3/4s of the way so I felt cheated. Wonton chips were old and we couldn't even chew them so that was a waste of money.
Their food was tasty and seasoned perfectly! The restaurant was very clean and the staff very polite and friendly. I would go again!

Of all the Thai restaurants I have tried, this one has to be one of the best!!

I came across this place on a search of delicious foods to order off of Postmates, of course when I see a place I look on yelp for the amount of stars and reviews.

 Normally most places people complain about the customer service or the amount of food but this place I have seen neither.

The interior is adorable, it's cute has its own atmosphere that makes it comforting and romantic. I have yet to eat inside but I have ordered and gone to pick it up when I didn't want to pay a delivery charge. This place is located next to island sushi and red rice, it's a tiny parking lot but normally you can find a place to park. 

Right when you walk in, you are greeted by the kindest people who i believe own the place. They give you time to look at the menu if you are taking out but are eager to assist you if you are dining in. Super friendly and answers every and any question you may have.

Thai tea is an absolute favorite, I have to always order it. Not bitter, not overly sweet and not too creamy just perfect! The wonton soup with noodles is delicious, I'm a sucker for it. As well as the food, no matter what you get it's delicious. Definitely for dessert try the sticky rice with mango!

Great food, incredibly tasty! The service was quick too. I especially liked their version of potstickers. My 2 yr old son also agreed. He ate them all and wanted more, and he's a pretty picky 2yo.  I only wish their prices were lower so I could eat here more often.

I'm not sure if this place was opened on a dare.

How can you NOT cook your chicken satay all the way through?!
Drunken noodle dinner order was the size of a kids lunch plate.  Drowning your food in grease is not the way to go.

Did I mention the coconut shrimp that wasn't cooked all the way? 

Stay as far away as you can from this place

1. Coconut shrimp  
2. Chicken satay
3. Orange chicken that my kids wouldn't eat
4  fried banana 
5. 2 orders drunker noodles  (had to search for noodles)
$51....  


Cooked chicken is not pink on the inside.  
Review after review is the same.  Must be a reason.

The restaurant is beautiful and has a nice tranquil setting.  After I was asking a couple of questions, I'm glad they lowered the volume of the Thai music as it was a little bit loud to hold a conversation.  This restaurant was empty during a late Monday, but I managed to fit in their lunch special.  

The portion size for lunch is just that, nothing overwhelming.  I got the yellow Thai curry and the mint leaf, which were both mediocre at best.  Do not order mild, as the spice level were completely lacking.  Taking into consideration this was Thai food, I usually tend to order mild expecting a lot more spice based on the traditional chili used.  I was sorely wrong and regretted not ordering medium to spicy to get the whole experience.

The beef in my mint leaf was lacking any basil flavor, any mint flavor and absolutely no spice.  The Thai curry had the color, but I didn't care too much for the big chunks of potatoes or carrots.  I would say the smaller pieces would have done better and once again no spice in the mild level.  The only upside to both dishes, were the meats were tender.  With the lunch special, it came with a salad, eggroll and a bowl of soup.  I was excited about the soup even though it was a little heavy handed on the salt. The cabbage, the carrots, the hints of limu was a excellent mixture in the soup.  

I came, I tried, and this would not be my first choice of Thai food on Eastern Ave.

A 5 star for a Thai restaurant in a strip mall well let me break it down, service was great, seems like a family start up, they are in the pre-opening stage the food was tasty , the presentation top notch but they won me over with the full bar, no not just beer and wine. This to be finished with a complementary coconut ice cream. Will defiantly be back again and again.

First time here and had a great visit! Tom Yum Noodle Soup and Mixed Vegetable dinner were delicious! Both dishes were nicely seasoned, bringing out lots of delicious flavors. Coconut ice cream was just enough sweet to finish of the meal nicely. Staff were very nice and attentive. 

We'll be back!
